verses.text_plain: The vision of Obadiah. Edom Will Be Humbled Thus says the Lord God concerning Edom: We have heard a report from the Lord, and a messenger has been sent among the nations: “ Rise up! Let us rise against her for battle!”
verses.verse_html:
1The vision of Obadiah.

Edom Will Be Humbled

Thus says the Lord God aconcerning Edom:
bWe have heard a report from the Lord,
and a messenger has been sent among the nations:
“Rise up! Let us rise against her for battle!”

verses.text_plain: Behold, I will make you small among the nations; you shall be utterly despised.
verses.verse_html:
2Behold, I will make you small among the nations;
you shall be utterly despised. ▼
▼Or  Behold, I have made you small among the nations; you are utterly despised

tokens.text: Behold, I have made you small among the nations; you are utterly despised

footnotes.body_text: ▼Or Behold, I have made you small among the nations; you are utterly despised
footnotes.body_html: ▼Or  Behold, I have made you small among the nations; you are utterly despised

verses.text_plain: The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who live in the clefts of the rock, in your lofty dwelling, who say in your heart, “ Who will bring me down to the ground?”
verses.verse_html:
3 dThe pride of your heart has deceived you,
you who live in the clefts of the rock, ▼
▼Or Sela

in your lofty dwelling,
fwho say in your heart,
“Who will bring me down to the ground?”

verses.text_plain: Though you soar aloft like the eagle, though your nest is set among the stars, from there I will bring you down, declares the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
4Though you soar aloft like the eagle,
though your nest is set among the stars,
from there I will bring you down,

declares the Lord.

verses.text_plain: If thieves came to you, if plunderers came by night — how you have been destroyed!— would they not steal only enough for themselves? If grape gatherers came to you, would they not leave gleanings?
verses.verse_html:
5If gthieves came to you,
if plunderers came by night—
how you have been destroyed!—
would they not steal only enough for themselves?
If hgrape gatherers came to you,
would they not leave gleanings?

verses.text_plain: How Esau has been pillaged, his treasures sought out!
verses.verse_html:
6 iHow Esau has been pillaged,
his treasures sought out!

verses.text_plain: All your allies have driven you to your border; those at peace with you have deceived you; they have prevailed against you; those who eat your bread have set a trap beneath you— you have no understanding.
verses.verse_html:
7All your allies have driven you to your border;
those at peace with you have deceived you;
they have prevailed against you;
jthose who eat your bread ▼
▼Hebrew lacks  those who eat
 have set a trap beneath you—
lyou have ▼
▼Hebrew he has
 no understanding.

footnotes.body_html: ▼Hebrew lacks  those who eat

verses.text_plain: Will I not on that day, declares the Lord, destroy the wise men out of Edom, and understanding out of Mount Esau?
verses.verse_html:
8 nWill I not on that day, declares the Lord,
destroy the wise men out of Edom,
and understanding out of oMount Esau?

verses.text_plain: And your mighty men shall be dismayed, O Teman, so that every man from Mount Esau will be cut off by slaughter.
verses.verse_html:
9And your mighty men shall be dismayed, pO Teman,
so that every man from qMount Esau will be cut off by slaughter.

verses.text_plain: Because of the violence done to your brother Jacob, shame shall cover you, and you shall be cut off forever.
verses.verse_html:
10 rBecause of the violence done to your brother Jacob,
shame shall cover you,
sand you shall be cut off forever.

verses.text_plain: On the day that you stood aloof, on the day that strangers carried off his wealth and foreigners entered his gates and cast lots for Jerusalem, you were like one of them.
verses.verse_html:
11 tOn the day that you stood aloof,
uon the day that strangers carried off his wealth
and foreigners entered his gates
vand cast lots for Jerusalem,
you were like one of them.

verses.text_plain: But do not gloat over the day of your brother in the day of his misfortune; do not rejoice over the people of Judah in the day of their ruin; do not boast in the day of distress.
verses.verse_html:
12 wBut do not gloat over the day of your brother
in the day of his misfortune;
xdo not rejoice over the people of Judah
in the day of their ruin;
ydo not boast ▼
▼Hebrew  do not enlarge your mouth

in the day of distress.

footnotes.body_html: ▼Hebrew  do not enlarge your mouth

verses.text_plain: Do not enter the gate of my people in the day of their calamity; do not gloat over his disaster in the day of his calamity; do not loot his wealth in the day of his calamity.
verses.verse_html:
13 aaDo not enter the gate of my people
in the day of their calamity;
abdo not gloat over his disaster
in the day of his calamity;
acdo not loot his wealth
in the day of his calamity.

verses.text_plain: Do not stand at the crossroads to cut off his fugitives; do not hand over his survivors in the day of distress.
verses.verse_html:
14 adDo not stand at the crossroads
to cut off his fugitives;
do not hand over his survivors
in the day of distress.

verses.text_plain: For the day of the Lord is near upon all the nations. As you have done, it shall be done to you; your deeds shall return on your own head.
verses.verse_html:
15For aethe day of the Lord is near upon all the nations.
afAs you have done, it shall be done to you;
your deeds shall return on your own head.

verses.text_plain: For as you have drunk on my holy mountain, so all the nations shall drink continually; they shall drink and swallow, and shall be as though they had never been.
verses.verse_html:
16 agFor as you have drunk on ahmy holy mountain,
so all the nations shall drink continually;
they shall drink and swallow,
and shall be as though they had never been.

verses.text_plain: But in Mount Zion there shall be those who escape, and it shall be holy, and the house of Jacob shall possess their own possessions.
verses.verse_html:
17 aiBut in Mount Zion there shall be those who escape,
and it shall be holy,
ajand the house of Jacob shall possess their own possessions.

verses.text_plain: The house of Jacob shall be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau stubble; they shall burn them and consume them, and there shall be no survivor for the house of Esau, for the Lord has spoken.
verses.verse_html:
18 akThe house of Jacob shall be a fire,
and the house of Joseph a flame,
and the house of Esau alstubble;
they shall burn them and consume them,
amand there shall be no survivor for the house of Esau,

for the Lord has spoken.

verses.text_plain: Those of the Negeb shall possess Mount Esau, and those of the Shephelah shall possess the land of the Philistines; they shall possess the land of Ephraim and the land of Samaria, and Benjamin shall possess Gilead.
verses.verse_html:
19Those of anthe Negeb aoshall possess apMount Esau,
and those of the Shephelah shall possess aqthe land of the Philistines;
they shall possess the land of Ephraim and the land of arSamaria,
and Benjamin shall possess Gilead.

verses.text_plain: The exiles of this host of the people of Israel shall possess the land of the Canaanites as far as Zarephath, and the exiles of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad shall possess the cities of the Negeb.
verses.verse_html:
20The exiles of this host of the people of Israel
shall possess the land of the Canaanites as far as asZarephath,
and the exiles of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad
shall possess the cities of the Negeb.

verses.text_plain: Saviors shall go up to Mount Zion to rule Mount Esau, and the kingdom shall be the Lord’s.
verses.verse_html:
21 atSaviors shall go up to Mount Zion
to rule auMount Esau,
and avthe kingdom shall be the Lord’s.
